meanings.definition: Having a strong dislike or opposition to something.
meanings.sent1: She was averse to spicy food.
meanings.sent2: He is averse to taking risks.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed averse to wearing the tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The student was averse to the idea of studying all night.
meanings.sent5: The child was averse to eating vegetables, wrinkling his nose in distaste.

meanings.sent1: The dog was averse to going out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She felt averse to attending the party alone.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing mismatched socks made him averse.
meanings.sent4: The smell of rotten eggs made everyone averse to entering the room.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise made her averse to going to the concert.
